result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Foerster, Leah E

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Leah E Foerster in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to dismiss and read-in. Court grants and the matters are dismissed and read-in.

Defendant Leah E Foerster in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment as her client has been accepted in the Drug treatment court. Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Adjournment request filed by Attorney Bricco

Defendant Leah E Foerster in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment for plea and sentencing. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant to have no contact with any Pick n Save stores.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with witnesss listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Leah E Foerster in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
